member.name: T:ProfitBricks.Client.Service
member.summary: Represents a base class for all resources. Containing basic server operations.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Service.Create(ProfitBricks.POCO.ProfitBricksBase)
member.summary: Creates an instance of request used to create Profixt Bricks objects.
member.returns: Returns an instance of create request.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Service.Get
member.summary: Gets all objects of the resource.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Service.Show(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a single object of the resource

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Service.Update(ProfitBricks.POCO.ProfitBricksBase)
member.summary: Updates object passed onto the resource passed on.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Firewalls.Get
member.summary: Returns information about all configured firewall. Each rule has an identifier for later modification.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Firewalls.Show(System.String)
member.summary: Returns information about the state and configuration of an existing NIC.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Firewalls.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes one firewall of a given data center.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Firewalls.DeleteMany(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Deletes one or several firewall(s) of a given data center.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Firewalls.Activate(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Activates one or several firewall(s) of a given data center.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Firewalls.Deactivate(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Deactivates one or several firewall(s) of a given data center.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Firewalls.RemoveFirewallRules(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Removes firewall rule(s) by specifying their identifiers. See also getFirewall() or getNic() to retrieve identifiers of firewall rules.
member.param: Identifiers of the target firewall rules

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Images.SetImageOsType(System.String,ProfitBricks.POCO.Enums.OsType)
member.summary: Sets the OS Type of an individual HDD and/or CD-ROM/DVD image that has been uploaded on the ProfitBricks FTP server. The default OS Type of an uploaded image is UNKOWN. Due to Microsoft’s terms and conditions, the user has to set the OS Type of an uploaded Windows image to WINDOWS and therewith accepts the terms and conditions as well as the pricing. Any server that is booted from the image will inherit the OS Type of the image automatically.
member.param: Identifier of the target HDD or CD-ROM/DVD image
OS Type of the target HDD or CD-ROM/DVD image (WINDOWS, LINUX, OTHER, UNKNOWN)

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Images.Update(ProfitBricks.POCO.ProfitBricksBase)
member.summary: Updates information about a HDD or CD-ROM/DVD (ISO) image.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Images.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes an image. Please be aware that deleted images and related data in this image cannot be recovered anymore.
member.param: Identifier of the image that shall get deleted.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.LoadBalancers.Get
member.summary: Returns information about all virtual load balancer.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.LoadBalancers.Update(ProfitBricks.POCO.ProfitBricksBase)
member.summary: Changes the settings of an existing virtual load balancer.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.LoadBalancers.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes an existing load balancer. Primary IP addresses of the server’s previously balanced NICs are reset and replaced with ProfitBricks assigned IP address. If a load balancer has been deleted, all servers will still be connected to the same LAN though.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.LoadBalancers.RegisterServer(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Adds new servers to an existing Load Balancer within the respective LAN. If the server is not yet a member of the LAN, a new NIC is created, connected to the LAN and registered with the Load Balancer. The load balancer will distribute traffic to the server through this balanced NIC. If the server is already a member of the LAN, the appropriate NIC is used as balanced NIC. A server can be registered to more than one Load Balancer.
member.param: Identifier of servers to be registered with target load balancer

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.LoadBalancers.UnregisterServer(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: By deregistering a server, the server is being removed from the load balancer but still remains connected to the same LAN. The primary IP address of the NIC, through which the load balancer distributed traffic to the server before, is reset and replaced by a ProfitBricks assigned IP address.
member.param: Identifier of servers to be registered with target load balancer

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.LoadBalancers.ActivateLoadBalancer(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: This feature is not supported any longer. It is not possible to activate or deactivate load balancing on servers. In case you enable or disable servers from load balancing please use the following methods:

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Nics.Update(ProfitBricks.POCO.ProfitBricksBase)
member.summary: Changes the settings of an existing NIC.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Nics.SetInternetAccess(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Connects an existing NIC to a public LAN to get internet access.
member.param: Identifier of the target data center

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.PublicIpBlocks.Delete(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Removes a reserved public IP from a NIC. This operation is required, when dealing with reserved public IPs to ensure proper routing by the ProfitBricks cloud networking layer.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.PublicIpBlocks.ReleasePublicIpBlock(System.String)
member.summary: Releases an existing block of reserved public IPs.
member.param: Identifier of the reserved IP block

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.RomDrives.AddRomDrive(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a CD-ROM/DVD drive to an existing virtual server. Maximum CD-ROM/DVD Drives are currently 2.
member.param: Identifier of the target virtual server
Device number of the CD-ROM/DVD drive connected to the server. If no device number is set, a new device number will be assigned to the CD-ROM/DVD drive automatically

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.RomDrives.RemoveRomDrive(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Removes a CD-ROM/DVD drive from an existing virtual server.
member.param: Identifier of the target virtual server

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Snapshots.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a snapshot. Please be aware that deleted snapshots and related data in this snapshot cannot be recovered anymore.
member.param: Identifier of the snapshot that shall get deleted

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Snapshots.RollbackSnapshot(ProfitBricks.POCO.Requests.RollbackSnapshotRequest)
member.summary: Using the rollback option you may redeploy the snapshotted state on a storage. Attention: The current state of the storage will be lost unless you create another snapshot before rolling back.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.UserNotifications.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Gets all current (not deleted) user notifications. User notifications are created by the system to inform users about different events concerning e.g. their data centers. Notifications stay in the queue until deleted.
member.param: Uuid of the network the notification refers to

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.UserNotifications.Delete(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Deletes the notifications with the given ids.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Volumes.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes an existing virtual storage device.
member.param: Identifier of the target virtual storage. Required field.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Volumes.ConnectVolume(ProfitBricks.POCO.Requests.ConnectStorageRequest)
member.summary: Connects a virtual storage device to an existing server.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Volumes.DisconnectVolume(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Disconnects a virtual storage device from a connected server.
member.param: Identifier of the connected virtual storage
Identifier of the connected virtual server

member.name: T:ProfitBricks.Client.Helper.Converters
member.summary: Representa class that contains static methods for converting raw server objects into ProfitBricks Client library objects.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Helper.Converters.ConvertFirewallRules(ProfitBricks.Client.ProfitBricksProxy.firewallRule[])
member.summary: Converts collection of ProfitBricksProxy.firewallRule object into generic list ProfitBricks.POCO.FirewallRule

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.DataCenters.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes an Virtual Data Center. If a previous request on the target data center is still in progress, the data center is going to be deleted after this request has been completed. Once a Data Center has been deleted, no further request can be performed on it.
member.param: Identifier of the virtual data center

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.DataCenters.GetDataCenterState(System.String)
member.summary: This is a lightweight function for pooling the current provisioning state of the Virtual Data Center. It is recommended to use this function for large Virtual Data Centers to query request results.

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.DataCenters.ClearDataCenter(System.String)
member.summary: Removes all components from an existing Virtual Data Center.
member.param: Identifier of the virtual data center

member.name: T:ProfitBricks.Client.ProfitBricksClient
member.summary: ProfitBricksClient class is a wrapper of all the PB resouces

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Servers.Delete(System.String)
member.param: Identifier of the target virtual server

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Servers.ResetServer(System.String)
member.summary: Resets an existing virtual server (POWER CYCLE). - Server will be forcefully powered off and restarted immediately. Any unsaved data may be lost! - Billing will continue

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Servers.StartServer(System.String)
member.summary: Starts an existing virtual server - Server may receive new public IP addresses if necessary - Billing will continue

member.name: M:ProfitBricks.Client.Resources.Servers.StopServer(System.String)
member.summary: Stops an existing virtual server forcefully (HARD stop) - Server will be forcefully powered off. Any unsaved data may be lost! - Billing for this server will be stopped - When restarting the server a new public IP gets assigned, alternatively, you can reserve IP addresses,
